reviews.review_msg: jf williams writes his own reviews.

The course and content is honestly pretty hard, so I think its easy to blame him for getting a bad grade. But he does go over everything thoroughly in class, and answers your questions well. He's a good prof, just not the best curriculum, and tests are very difficult.

JF was very understanding that this course had life sciences students. Concepts were easy to understand and exams were fair. Do the practice exams, as the questions will be very similar. Overall a nice prof and very approachable!
Exams were fair and assignments weren't too difficult.  He cares about his students and wants them to succeed.

Was really behind because I had to miss about a month of school + Midterm 2 due to a car accident, but JF was very patient and understanding. I had only about ~1.5week to prep for the final, but he encouraged me to try my best. inspired me to study very hard. He graded very fairly at the end, given my context. Very happy with my final grade!
His exams are fair and he is willing to help students, do the practice problems he gives before exams .
He nailed Math 155 perfectly. Exams are pretty fair
JF is one awesome dude and a pretty good prof too

JF is very aware of the fact this course is for life science majors and teaches its accordingly. Exams were all reasonable, just practice the problem sets from class and the practice exams. He's a very caring professor whos looking out for the class.

He understands that anyone in Math155 (life science math) isn't a math major, and treats the course accordingly. You only really learn what matters, which I appreciate. The content focuses on relevant techniques, as opposed to abstract and purely mathematical concepts that you would find in a regular calculus class. Exams are easy enough.

If you're not a math major, and it's been awhile since you've seen math maybe cuz of coop or something, lectures become really hard to understand, like very difficult. Sat there scratching my head. But if you go to OH, get help, he'll explain things to you well and you'll get a good understanding for exams, the computing reports and whatnot.

It was a difficult course and you need to put in a fair amount of effort, but he tried his best to make it related to real-life/practical problems and the purpose of the course clear. The computing reports were like puzzles but interesting, you can get help during OH and tutorials. He needs to be aware of cheating during quizzes/exams though.

I think he's a good prof and try to make the class interesting by relating the concepts to real life use cases. His notes have mistakes sometimes but it's math so I think it's normal.
MACM 316 is hard to understand, if you're not into math like me. I'm on the edge of failing this course if not curved, but tbh I still think JF is good lmao

Don't go to the lectures without doing the textbook readings first, because he goes through the material really fast. His class has a heavy focus on MATLAB assignments. Weekly MATLAB assignments and weekly quizzes make the course way heavier than I expected. I wish I had more time to understand math instead of looking up MATLAB commands.

I thought this course would be incredibly boring but JF includes many relevant and interesting examples in lectures. The computing reports are difficult but he is very helpful during office hours and really takes the time to explain things.

he only created prelectures for MATH 155 but he designed all the midterms and final. the final was literally just like the midterms, super straightforward and they were not marked hard. the midterms are just like the problem sets that are done in class. practice the material and if you know how to do them, you definitely will get an A.

MATH 155- I'm not sure why he received many bad reviews, seems more like the same individual wrote many bad reviews about him over and over. He is not bad, yeah he talks fast but he does not test you on anything you have NOT learned in class. Exams were literally straightforward, question are out of the lecture notes.
Collective opinion on this guy is that he is horrible
Useless prof, hated by all
Eligible writing and overcomplicates everything
Unstable node
Curving* not cutting
Curved us down do I'm cutting down his rating
Makes lots of errors and is inconsiderate
Unwanted prof at sfu
Curved us down, bad at teaching
MATH 155 - buddy can't teach and scaled down the final marks :/

Math 155. Do not take any courses with him, his writing is illegible and he speaks and writes very fast. I have to pause every few seconds and rewind to reread whatever he wrote or listen again. He does not explain what he is teaching. It almost seems like he is talking to himself. Avoid.

MATH 155
He messed up one lecture about unstable spirals and I believed the wrong material for the longest time. Terrible.

He is great at explaining any question you have, makes you feel comfortable and not afraid to ask him for help. He tries to be very open and you can see all his efforts at making this tough time easier for all of us. Lots of homework, group works etc but easy to do due to the explanations and slides he constantly provides. Best prof I've had.

Best prof hands down for math130. Great attitude and genuine care towards students especially in these tough times during the pandemic. Very understanding prof and listens to what you have to say. Challenging class but office hours are very helpful.

He is a very nice and understanding prof. His assignments and group assignments were fair and he was flexible with due dates if he noticed the students were struggling. Lectures can be tough to follow, so going to office hours were very helpful. Hes really willing to help and guide students to find the answer. He wants us to succeed!

The most nicest, caring prof I've ever met. Cares about the price you pay for tuition. Will help you when you're falling behind. Gets that university is hard for students. Even if you're doing bad, he'll make sure you get something out of the effort you put in. Thanks for this semester JF!

This was my toughest course so far into my degree, but also one I learned the most from. It's improved the way I think about math, and in general sharpened my critical thinking skills. If you're actually willing to put in 2-3 hours for reviewing the material from each lecture, take this course with JF. You'll have to work hard, but it's worth it.
Really good teacher, cares a lot about students. Very engaging.

Hard to understand his class notes, but if you go to his office hours, he is helpful. Math 232 is pretty much a subject that needs a lot of self-learning, so don't expect him to teach you everything. His grading is reasonable, and if you think you can get more marks, just talk to him. Also, late email response time as well.
Never uploaded class notes. Hard to read his hand writing. Hard to catch the lecture notes.

He is truly *not* nice to students and the only time he's being clear is during his office hours. He actually gets annoyed when he finds that not many students come to class and ignores students who do. He's quite fake, if you have known him from the beginning of the semester to the end you'll agree with me. Likes to blame students. Be warned.

His lectures are very rushed. If you want to pass you have to go through the textbook as he doesn't cover much in class and skips through a lot of material. He is VERY judgmental which makes a lot of students like me, scared to ask questions. It's very clear that he doesn't care about his students as people, unlike other instructors I have had.

i would like to say that this guy is not bad, but absolutely is not a good prof. So many stuff you need to do before and after classes. The lectures are very rushed, you will not learn anything if you don't prepare. The quizzes and midterms are rush too!!! Don't select this guy if you have other options!!!

I have been very successful in all my courses, but this one is an absolute struggle. Math isn't even the issue, the lecture style is just unhelpful as it's completely rushed and we are supposed to already know everything. The prof puts the onus of learning the material on the students and is very intimidating to approach for help. Good luck.

It seems that downloading the notes he writes in class and learning off of them on your own is a better solution than going to lecture since it's basically the same content. The advantages of downloading the notes are not having to go through him correcting himself over and over, and being able to stay at home in a comfortable environment. MATH130.

1. Goes through lectures too fast, only covers the basic ideas and not anything you might see on a test. 2. Attitude seems like "its on you guys to learn, not my problem if you fail" seems to blame incompetence and lack of work of students for low averages on tests. (key term: average) 3. Tests are rushed, if you don't know something, skip it.

U have to pay $25 for online assignments which are weighted 10% of the whole course, which didn't happen when I took this course in Fall 2017, so does online assignments help you with better understanding of this course? I don't think so, if doing homeworks online makes you a better student then why do we need a professor? Freaking hilarious.

Avoid at all costs if you can take w/ someone else. Got an A, but it was hell. Midterms were speed tests, blows over material and doesn't provide adequate explanations, and in the very last class he zoomed over an obscure topic with barely any background information and it was on the final. Basically learned on my own through the textbook.

Makes a large number of mistakes in lectures and wastes time correcting them. Great otherwise.  All the people complaining are crybabies that don't like how JF tries to instill intuition within his students.

A prof who challenges his students. He made me respect and want to learn the depths that come with Calculus. Exams can be difficult if you are one that masters the art of solving certain problems, but lack the mastery of solving the problem transformed. Weekly quizzes (10%) + Loncapa (5%) + 2 MTs (35%) + 1 Final (50%)  JF Williams Math 251
midterms always hard even ta said his test is tricker than others. So much stuff has been covered for each lecs too

Had a very difficult midterm. Most questions are sort of like trick questions in an unfamiliar format coupled with very a long paper. Expects too much from the students who are taking 200 level courses. Avoid when you can because on the fourth week he will suggest you to drop out if you find his course tough anyways (with tuition fees penalty).
He is a crystal clear lecturer and his midterms are pretty straight forward. Easy A.
He is keep making mistakes and getting lost in his lecture.

I found him helpful and was a good lecturer. The course was definitely not easy and assignments took forever. But I enjoyed it and got "A". He has encouraged me to do math modeling competition and other activities. However when I refused to continuing grad school at sfu, he wrote me bad references to schools that I applied. Such a terrible person.
Very unclear and everywhere during lectures!

one of the worst profs i've ever had. attending lectures only confused me more. he seems very lazy; he pretty much re-used midterms and even the final. he only changed numbers and a couple questions on the final. after midterms he would go over them... it does not help, the way he solves the problems only made me shake my head. AVOID AT ALL COST!!!

He is a nice guy.However,He went the material so fast that you have to relearn all the material at home.His exam is extremely hard and ridiculously long.He will give u his own style of question that you will never find on your textbook.average for this class is around 48%. So if u are not enjoying in the materials, take it with another prof.
easy material. He is very smart and a good grader :)

Guy sucks at teaching this course. He's very confusing in the lectures and you have to read the text to even grasp the section "taught". Why does he have a job teaching? Seems like a nice guy, but he just should not be an instructor.

Lectures seem delivered on spot (nevertheless relevant to the week's topic). Assignments are difficult in the sense that they do not have written solutions. Exam was a wreck for everyone. On the plus side, JF is a genius and will likely have an answer to your question. He is approachable and will give you a good mark if you put in the time.

he was pissed off if someone studied in class and not listened to him during lecture; may be he should respect his students more; a few times he just shouted across the room and threatened us that he would not delay the quiz at all cost.

I don't understand what he taught during the lecture most of the time. You MUST read/study the textbook at home(on your own) and figure out all the questions he assignment to you. Then, you will get a good grade.

One of the few profs that can teach in an *intuitive* manner. He doesn't care about the details, but gives you the big picture of formulae/expressions. Nice guy but expects you to work too hard. Gives good grades.
He's really friendly and fair.  Maybe he made the course harder than it should be, but I was entertained nonetheless.  Mass scaling helped me get my grade.  Really friendly and great guy!
He would give you his own applications, not like apps in the textbook, and his apps is hard to understand. He hardly responds your emails, I sent him totally 5 emails but only one was responded

His handwriting is generally illegible and he usually goes too fast. Definitely recommend reading the textbook before going to class. His exams are a little on the difficult side, but always remember to justify everything.
Hes ok, but what the last poster said is right, you wont see anything in class on your midterm!

JF tries to get the material accross but he just can't.  He only goes over the simplest examples in lecture, and does everything so fast that you don't understand the how.  Often says "just stare at it" as an answer but the TA's dont accept this when marking the MT.  Some things he says in lecture if you write on a MT are marked Wrong. Try to avoid

Math 251 is itself a hard course already and he made it even harder. midterms are fair. the final exam was brutal but definitely possible to do well if you really understand ALL of the assignments. lectures are lively but useless, abuse your textbook as much as you can. work hard and you should be amply rewarded

JF is a very nice and friendly person. His lectures are useless and waste of your time. His midterms way too long, no one finished it. His final exams is long and unfair. The average for final exams was 48%...i worked very hard for this course and i am a smart guy, But my actuall grade was barelly passing, he scales 20% at the end but he sucks at t
Homework seems relevant to exams...though still challenging Dunno what to say...He is the friendliest person you'll meet though.
Nice teacher BUT bad lectures you dont learn anything and messy notes AND HARD tests and quizes every week
WHAT A LIVING HELL
hard class but fun. jf works hard and expects you to work hard. gives god grades :)
Very itneresting class but hard!  He is nice and tries hard but their is so much to learn.  JF makes you work hard but then gives you a good grade.  Made me switch to applied math.

JF is nice and kind. Very helpful and informative though his handwriting should improve. But the course sucks, really sucks. It covers a WIDE range of topics in Math, and probably for 2nd Yr undergrads, you 've never seen them. Because of that, many 4th year students taking this course.Plus, don't buy the text, never used it for a single lecture.
Course is hard, but his marking is such a generous
